title: Will they never come?
Don't stand looking at this. Go and help!
Think! Are you content for him to fight for you? Won't you do your bit? We shall win but you must help. Join to-day
There is still a place in the line for you. Will you fill it?
Another call "More men and still more until the enemy is crushed" Lord Kitchener / Elk ; A. Vaughan, Government Photolithographer
There is still a place in the line for you. Will you fill it?
The trumpet calls / Norman Lindsay
"Get into khaki"; we are doing our bit / H.M. Burton
Boys come over here, you're wanted / Issued by the South Australian Government, A. Vaughan Government Photolithographer
Do you realise our peril ? J. Newland, State Recruiting Committee
Railways and Tramways Infantry Reinforcement Unit A.I.F. now being formed / Issued by the N.S.W. Recruiting Committee
Recruiting train. Will you respond? The recruiting train is coming your way. Jump aboard

All eligible men will be given free clothing, food, money, steamer and train accommodation, and a trip full of adventure and interest, forming the greatest event of their lives ... on application to any recruiting officer (Sgd.) J. Newland, Chairman State Recruiting Committee
To arms! Play the game! Looking on is not cricket! Enlist (Sgd.) J. Newland, Chairman State Recruiting Committee
If this cap fits you. Join the Army to-day / Parliamentary Recruiting Committee
State Parliament. Recruiting Week. Mon., 5th July to Sat., 10th July

To arms! Samples of true grit are to be met in abundance in all training camps ... "Stiffen the sinews, summon up the blood" (Sgd.) J. Newland, Chairman State Recruiting Committee, 4th Military District
Britain's strong arm and yours will carry us through, enlist now
Make victory swift and certain. Offer your services now
50,000 men wanted
"We are fighting for a worthy purpose, and we shall not lay down our arms until that purpose has been fully achieved" The King. Men of the Empire to arms! God save the King!
"And his soul goes marching on" P. Bagnell
Australians! Your country needs you
To the women of Australia
Recruiting, Federal electorate of ... Enlist
What will your answer be when your boy asks you, "Father, what did you do to help when Britain fought for freedom in 1915?" Enlist now
War : Recruiting depot at Hornsby
Why are you stopping here when your pals are out there?
The latest despatch : send more men. Age 18 to 45 / Norman Keene
N.S.W. Recruiting Campaign. A recruiting meeting will be held at ... on ... at ... speakers
Get into khaki. Your comrades at Gallipoli are calling you. This is not the time for football and tennis matches. It is serious. Show that you realise this by enlisting at once

The War! N.S.W. Recruiting Campaign. A monster meeting Exhibition Building Prince Alfred Park. Saturday Night. July 31 at 8 o'clock. Speakers: Prime Minister, Premier, Chief Justice, Archbishop of Sydney, State Commandant, Hon. Joseph Cook, Hon. C.G. Wade an other leading citizens. More men are urgently required. Come along to the meeting prepared to enlist
Would you stand by while a bushfire raged? get busy, and drive the Germans back! / Harry J. Weston

The War! N.S.W. Recruiting Campaign. A monster meeting Exhibition Building Prince Alfred Park. Saturday Night. July 31 at 8 o'clock. Speakers: Prime Minister, Premier, Chief Justice, Archbishop of Sydney, State Commandant, Hon. Joseph Cook, Hon. C.G. Wade an other leading citizens. More men are urgently wanted. Come along to the meeting prepared to enlist
Don't falter go and meet the Hun menace
Commonwealth of Australia, Expeditionary Forces, recruits wanted, conditions of enlistment. Every man physically fit is wanted
Don't stand looking at this, go and help!
Enlist. Always Huns. Protect our women and children, join the Australian Army
Lloyd George's message to Australia. Enlist! And help your Australian comrades
Your country needs you : Fall in!
Commonwealth of Australia, Expeditionary Forces, recruits wanted, conditions of enlistment. Every man physically fit is wanted
Britain's strong arm and yours will carry us through, enlist now
Lloyd George's message to Australia. Enlist! And help your Australian comrades
A call from the Dardanelles : coo-ee won't you come? : enlist now / H.M. Burton
Join the ANZAC Union and get into khaki
Shackleton's call to Australia!
Boys come over here, you're wanted
Enlist, by staying at home you are giving your approval to this kind of thing
Make victory swift and certain. Offer your services now

Open-Air War meeting. Burwood Road near Burwood Railway Station. Friday, September 17, 1915. At 8 o'clock. Speakers: Captain F.W. Kane (recently returned from Gallipoli) and Albert Bruntnell, Esq. Rally around the flag!
"We are fighting for a worthy purpose,  and we shall not lay down our arms until that purpose has been fully achieved" The King. Men of the Empire to arms! God save the King!

War Meeting. Coronation Hall, Waverley near Bondi Junction. Thursday, August 12, 1915 at 8 o'clock. The Mayor will preside. Speakers: Sir Joseph Carruthers, K.C.M.G., M.L.C., Professor David, Mr. A.G. Ralston, K.C., Rev. Professor McIntyre, Colonel Onslow, M.L.A., Mr. J. Fingleton, M.L.A. and Captain W.L. Johnston (from the Dardanelles) ... Rally round the flag!
South Australians, fall in : we want you at the front : come and help, enlist at once / C. Wall

Kitchener's solemn warning "... In every man's life there is one supreme hour towards which all early experience moves, and from which all future results may be reckoned. For every individual Briton, as well as our national existence, that solemn hour is now striking"

War meeting. Corner Bourke, Fitzroy, & Foveaux Sts. Surry Hills, Friday Aug. 6, 1915 at 8 o'clock. Speakers: Hon. Frank Bryant, M.L.C., Mr. T.S. Crawford, M.L.A., Mr. D. Levy, M.L.A., Mr. S. Davoreen and other prominent citizents. Rally round the flag!
Defend your homes, your women and children. Enlist! Now! J.S. Watkins
War meeting, Masonic Hall Hurstville, Monday, Aug. 9, 1915, 8pm, Capt. Toombs and other speakers, back up your flag!
War meeting. School of Arts Five Dock, Friday, September 10, 1915 At 8 o'clock. speakers: Captain F.W. Kane (recently returned from Gallipoli) and Albert Bruntnell Esq. Rally round the flag!
War meeting. Burwood Road near railway station. Friday, September 3, 1915 at 8 o'clock. Speakers: Senator Watson, Messrs. J.C.L. Fitzpatrick and George Cann, Ms.L.A. Rally round the flag!
War meeting. Town Hall, Glebe, Monday, Aug. 9, 1915 at 8 o'clock, Speakers: W.A. Holman, M.L.A., Mr. T. Keegan, M.L.A., Mr.  A. Bruntnell. And other prominent citizens. Rally round the flag!

Brothers beyond the seas. "We shall need every man that we can put in the field, Every pound that rigid public and private economy can provide, and every effort which a united people can put forth to help in the heavy task of our soldiers and sailors". Lloyd George

Open-Air meetings. Friday August 27, 1915. Bondi Junction 7.45 pm. Charing Cross 8.45 pm. Speakers: Sir. J.H. Carruthers, Messrs. J. Fingleton, M.L.A. and A. Bruntnell. Rev. Professor MacIntyre. The Mayor of Waverley (Alderman Barracluff), and other prominent citizens. The Waverley Rifle Club and local Bands will co-operate. Rally round the Flag!

War meeting. Marrickville Town Hall, Post Office corner. Friday, Aug. 6, 1915 at 8 o'clock. Speaker: Hon. W.E. Johnson, M.P., Mr. T.S. Crawford, M.L.A., Mr. Tom Hoskins, M.L.A., and other prominent citizens. Rally round the flag!

War meeting. A public meeting, School of Arts, Wyong, Wednesday, Sept. 1, 1915 8 p.m. To bid farewell to some of our departing soldier boys. Speakers: E.J. Loxton, K.C., J. Carlos, Barrister and Private H.H. Coates. All are invited

War meeting. Roseville Hall, Thursday, September 23, 1915 at 8 o'clock. Speakers: Captain Kane, from the Dardanelles (wounded), Mr. E.J. Loxton, M.A., K.C., Private Coates, Deputy Registrar-General of New South Wales (leaving for the front), Rev. S.J. Hoban (a witty and eloquent Victorian). Rally round the flag!
Fight for freedom with the strength of free men
Enlist at once
Under which flag will you live? Enlist at once
Enlist now
Enlist!! Today!!
Under which flag will you live? Enlist at once
Why you should enlist in the Sports Unit
The cry of the mothers, Australians! Enlist now! J.S. Watkins
What will your answer be when your boy asks you, "Father, what did you do to help when Britain fought for freedom in 1915?" Enlist now
It is more serious than you think : the barbarian is almost at your gates ; he violates, plunders, murders ; don't let him get a footing on British soil ; help to repell the invasion by enlisting now
We took the hill, come and help us keep it / Harry J. Weston
There's room for you : jump aboard
Australians! Your country needs you
Can you fight? The empire needs every fit man. If the Germans win, no home on British soil will be safe. Wives, daughters, mothers will be at the mercy of the barbarian. Enlist now
Can you fight? The empire needs every fit man. If the Germans win, no home on British soil will be safe. Wives, daughters, mothers will be at the mercy of the barbarian. Enlist now
Come on boys! Give us a hand! J.S. Watkins
"Get a move on old man!" Harry J Weston
War meeting, Exhibition Building, July 31, 8 p.m., back up your country
The War. How we compare with other countries
The only good German is a dead German
Even up the roll call
'"Hark! Hark! The dogs do bark!"
Proclaimation, Reinforcements Referendum
New Zeland Expeditionary Force. Reinforcements
Join our O. B. U. One Big Union The Khakis
"You're proud of your pals in the Army of course! But what will your pals think of you?" Think it over!
Come!
You? Your cobbers need you. Join the AIF
We shall need every man we can put in the field
To the women of Australia / issued by the South Australian Government
Think! Are you content for him to fight for you? Won't you do your bit? We shall win but you must help. Join to-day
"U" are wanted in the Sport's unit / Harry J. Weston
Reinforcements referendum : vote yes
[Collection of newscuttings illustrating the volunteer enlistment effort for World War I]
"Were you there then?" Harry J Weston

War meeting. Eastwood school of Arts, Thursday, September 2, 1915 at 8 p.m. Speakers: E.J. Loxton, Esq. K.C., Professor David, J. Carlos, Esq., Barrister, Private P.H. Coates. Musical items. All are invited
War meeting, Harbour Trust Workshop, ... Tuesday mid-day meeting 10th Aug., 1915,  at 12.15 p.m. ... rally round the flag!
War! A public meeting, School of Arts, Gosford, Friday Sept. 3, 1915 at 8 p.m. ... free - all are invited
War meeting. Town Hall, Bankstown, Thursday, Aug. 12, 1915 at 8 o'clock. Rally round the flag!
War meeting, Town Hall, Lane Cove, Thursday, Aug. 12, 1915. At 8 o'clock. Rally round the flag!

War meeting. Gladesville Theatre, Gladesville. Wednesday, August 11, 1915. at 8 o'clock. The Mayor will preside. Speakers: Mr. W. Thompson, M.L.A., Mr. P. McGarry, M.L.A., Mr. A.J. Kelynack. Rally Round The Flag!
War meeting. Town Hall Elizabeth Street Waterloo, Thursday August 12, 1915 at 8 o'clock. The mayor will preside. Rally round the flag!
War meeting, Lackey St, Summer Hill, opposite Tucker's shop, Friday 6th Aug., 1915, At 8 o'clock. Rally round the Flag!
War meeting. Town Hall, Ryde, Friday. Aug. 6, 1915 at 8 o'clock, Speakers: Mr. Justice Harvey, Rev. N.J. Cocks. Rally round the flag!
War meeting. Town Hall, Alexandria, 6th Aug., 1915 at 8 p.m., Speakers: A.B. Piddington Esq. Chief Interstate Commissioner, The Hon. James Wilson, M.L.C. Rally round the flag!
War meeting. Picture Palace Campsie. Tuesday, Aug. 10, 1915 at 8 o'clock. Rally round the flag!

War meeting. Town Hall, Leichhardt, Tuesday 10th Aug., 1915 at 8 o'clock. The mayor will preside. Speakers: C. Carmichael, Esq., M.L.A., The Hon. W.T. Dick, M.L.C., Rev. F.V. Dowling M.A., Mr. F.S. Boyce. Rally round the flag!

War meeting. Woolloomooloo Bay on vacant lot end of Dowling Street, Thursday 5th Aug., 1915 at 12.30. Speakers: Professor David, R. Holls, M.L.A., Rev. Captain Bernsteen, P. McGarry, M.L.A. Rally round the flag!
Kitchener says "For every individual Briton, as well as for our national existence, the solemn hour is now striking!"
Liberty or slavery "You must choose!" Harry J. Weston
"Fancy not wantin' to go Bill! Harry J. Weston
Follow your mates, Enlist / John Sands Ltd
It's our flag : fight for it, work for it
[Scenes of Blue Mountains and Katoomba town, N.S.W.]
The latest despatch : send more men. Age 18 to 45 / Norman Keene
War meeting, town hall, Auburn : Saturday, August 21, 1915 at 8 o'clock
